thread.title: Craft Supply Spotlight: Craft Foam

title: Craft Supply Spotlight: Craft Foam
text:
Free Coloring Pages and Printable Projects 
I'm happy to be featuring another fabulous must-have kid craft supply - craft foam ! We're spotlighting all the amazing ways you can craft with this material, perfect for so many kids crafts. You've seen it all over the craft isles in large sheets, small sheets, and small shapes. There are different shapes and symbols or all sorts of craft foam letters too. It comes in all sorts of colors and some sheets come with sticky backs for fun crafts! 
Craft foam is a fun material to work with, similar to paper, but more firm and sturdy. It's also very bendable and easy to manipulate. You can cut, glue, fold, bend, and staple this cool craft foam. It's great to use with little ones as it's soft and easy to manipulate. 
Here are 10 fun craft ideas to make with craft foam: 
continue reading below our video 7 Steps to Organize Your Craft Room 
1. Silly Straw Sippers - Sip on these silly straw sippers made from craft foam. These can be crafted into any shape for some silly fun, or great to make for your parties or holidays! 
2. Heart Friendship Bracelets - These are perfect to make and give as a classroom gift for the kids or just for some neighbors and friends. 
3. Crafty Garden Markers - We made these fun and easy foam garden markers that will make it through any rainy days and help us remember what we planted. And they also add a touch of whimsy. 
4. Mother's Day Cards - Turn these tricky craft foam shaped words into a cute card for Mother’s Day. Mom will be Wowed by the surprise! 
5. Flying Flower Frisbees - We’re making our own flowers out of frisbees and flying them into a giant pot! Perfect for a flower power party! 
6. Monster Feet for Kids - Plan a monster mash and craft up these foam feet for the kids at the party! 
7. Silly Spider Hats - Adding pipe cleaners, another of my favorite craft supplies, to a craft foam hat will turn it into a super silly spider hat! 
8. Floating Sponge Boats - Float sponge boats in the backyard water table with sponges and craft foam sails! 
9. Bath Time Toys - To help my kids get in the tub, we made some Foam Bath Toys cut into all kinds of shapes. You can trace the shape first or simply cut them out. 
10. Foam Swirly Snakes - Super slithery s akes are easily made with a large craft foam circle and scissors. 
Have tons of fun crafting with craft foam! Related Articles
